title: A 0.500 g sample of tin (Sn) is reacted with oxygen to give 0.534 g of product. What is the percent mass of the tin and percent by mass of oxygen in the sample? - Quora

response.answer_text: If the tin reacted completely with oxygen: 0.534 g compound - 0.500 g Sn = 0.034 g O % composition = mass of element/mass of compound × 100 % Sn = 0.500 g/0.534 g × 100 = 93.6% Sn % O = 0.034 g/0.534 g × 100 = 6.4% O You could also subtract 93.6% from 100% to determine the % composition of oxygen.
